00063 //=============================================================================
00064 // CLASS sc_process_handle
00065 //
00066 // This class provides access to an sc_process_b object instance in a
00067 // manner which allows some persistence after the deletion of the actual
00068 // process.
00069 //=============================================================================
00070 class sc_simcontext;
00071 class SC_API sc_process_handle {
00072     typedef sc_process_handle this_type;
00073 
00074     friend bool operator == ( const this_type& left, const this_type& right );
00075     friend bool operator != ( const this_type& left, const this_type& right );
00076     friend bool operator < ( const this_type& left, const this_type& right );
00077     friend class sc_object;
00078     friend class sc_join;
00079     friend class sc_module;
00080     friend class sc_reset;
00081     friend class sc_sensitive;
00082     friend class sc_sensitive_pos;
00083     friend class sc_sensitive_neg;
00084     friend class sc_thread_process;
00085 
00086   public:
00087     inline sc_process_handle();
00088     inline explicit sc_process_handle( sc_object* object_p );
00089     inline explicit sc_process_handle( sc_process_b* process_p );
00090     inline sc_process_handle( const sc_process_handle& orig );
00091     inline ~sc_process_handle();
00092     inline sc_process_handle& operator = ( sc_process_handle src );
00093     inline void swap( sc_process_handle& other );
00094 
00095   public:
00096     inline void disable(
00097         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants=SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00098     inline bool dynamic() const;
00099     inline void enable(
00100         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants=SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00101     inline const std::vector<sc_event*>& get_child_events() const;
00102     inline const std::vector<sc_object*>& get_child_objects() const;
00103     inline sc_object* get_parent_object() const;
00104     inline sc_object* get_process_object() const;
00105     inline bool is_unwinding() const;
00106     inline void kill(
00107         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants=SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00108     inline const char* name() const;
00109     inline const char* basename() const;
00110     inline sc_curr_proc_kind proc_kind() const;
00111     inline void reset(
00112         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants=SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00113     inline sc_event& reset_event() const;
00114     inline void resume(
00115         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants=SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00116     inline void suspend(
00117         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants=SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00118     inline void sync_reset_off(
00119         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants=SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00120     inline void sync_reset_on(
00121         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants=SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00122     inline sc_event& terminated_event();
00123     inline bool terminated() const;
00124     template<typename EXCEPT>
00125     inline void throw_it( const EXCEPT& exception,
00126         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants=SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00127     inline bool valid() const;
00128 
00129   public: // implementation specific methods:
00130     inline std::string dump_state() const;
00131 
00132   protected:
00133     inline bool dont_initialize() const
00134         { return m_target_p ? m_target_p->dont_initialize() : false; }
00135     inline void dont_initialize( bool dont );
00136 
00137   public:
00138     operator sc_process_b* ()
00139         { return m_target_p; }
00140     operator sc_cthread_handle ();
00141     operator sc_method_handle ();
00142     operator sc_thread_handle ();
00143 
00144   protected:
00145     sc_process_b* m_target_p;   // Target for this object instance.
00146 
00147   protected:
00148     static std::vector<sc_event*>  empty_event_vector;  // If m_target_p == 0.
00149     static std::vector<sc_object*> empty_object_vector; // If m_target_p == 0.
00150     static sc_event                non_event;           // If m_target_p == 0.
00151 };
00152 
00153 inline bool operator == (
00154     const sc_process_handle& left, const sc_process_handle& right )
00155 {
00156     return (left.m_target_p != 0) && (right.m_target_p != 0) &&
00157         (left.m_target_p == right.m_target_p);
00158 }
00159 
00160 inline bool operator != (
00161     const sc_process_handle& left, const sc_process_handle& right )
00162 {
00163     return (left.m_target_p == 0) || (right.m_target_p == 0) ||
00164         (left.m_target_p != right.m_target_p);
00165 }
00166 
00167 inline bool operator < (
00168     const sc_process_handle& left, const sc_process_handle& right )
00169 {
00170     return left.m_target_p < right.m_target_p;
00171 }
00172 
00173 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00174 //"sc_process_handle::sc_process_handle - non-pointer constructor"
00175 //
00176 // This version of the object instance constructor for this class creates
00177 // an object instance whose target needs to be supplied via an assignment.
00178 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00179 inline sc_process_handle::sc_process_handle() : m_target_p(0)
00180 {
00181 }
00182 
00183 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00184 //"sc_process_handle::sc_process_handle - pointer constructor"
00185 //
00186 // This version of the object instance constructor for this class creates
00187 // an object instance whose target is the supplied sc_object instance.
00188 // The supplied sc_object must in fact be an sc_process_b instance.
00189 //     object_p -> sc_object instance this is handle for.
00190 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00191 inline sc_process_handle::sc_process_handle( sc_object* object_p ) :
00192     m_target_p(dynamic_cast<sc_process_b*>(object_p))
00193 {
00194     if ( m_target_p ) m_target_p->reference_increment();
00195 }
00196 
00197 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00198 //"sc_process_handle::sc_process_handle - pointer constructor"
00199 //
00200 // This version of the object instance constructor for this class creates
00201 // an object instance whose target is the supplied sc_process_b instance.
00202 // This saves a dynamic cast compared to the sc_object* case.
00203 //     process_p -> process instance this is handle for.
00204 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00205 inline sc_process_handle::sc_process_handle( sc_process_b* process_p ) :
00206   m_target_p(process_p)
00207 {
00208   if ( m_target_p ) m_target_p->reference_increment();
00209 }
00210 
00211 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00212 //"sc_process_handle::sc_process_handle - copy constructor"
00213 //
00214 // This version of the object instance constructor for this class provides
00215 // the copy constructor for the class. It clones the supplied original
00216 // handle and increments the references to its target.
00217 //     orig = sc_process_handle object instance to be copied from.
00218 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00219 inline sc_process_handle::sc_process_handle( const sc_process_handle& orig ) :
00220     m_target_p(orig.m_target_p)
00221 {
00222     if ( m_target_p ) m_target_p->reference_increment();
00223 }
00224 
00225 
00226 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00227 //"sc_process_handle::operator ="
00228 //
00229 // This assignment operator signature is call by value rather than reference.
00230 // This means that an sc_process_handle instance will be created and the
00231 // target for that instance will be incremented before the assignment is done.
00232 // The assignment is done using the swap() method, which simply swaps the
00233 // targets of 'orig' and this object instance. We don't need to increment
00234 // the reference count for our new target since that was done when 'orig'
00235 // was created. Our old target's reference count will be decremented when
00236 // 'orig' is deleted.
00237 //     orig = sc_process_handle object instance to be copied from.
00238 // Result is a reference for this object instance.
00239 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00240 inline sc_process_handle&
00241 sc_process_handle::operator = ( sc_process_handle orig )
00242 {
00243     swap( orig );
00244     return *this;
00245 }
00246 
00247 
00248 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00249 //"sc_process_handle::~sc_process_handle"
00250 //
00251 // This is the object instance destructor for this class. It decrements
00252 // the reference count for its target.
00253 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00254 inline sc_process_handle::~sc_process_handle()
00255 {
00256     if ( m_target_p ) m_target_p->reference_decrement();
00257 }
00258 
00259 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00260 //"sc_process_handle::inline methods"
00261 //
00262 // These are short inline methods.
00263 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00264 
00265 // disable this object instance's target.
00266 
00267 inline void sc_process_handle::disable(sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants)
00268 {
00269     if ( m_target_p )
00270         m_target_p->disable_process(descendants);
00271     else
00272         SC_REPORT_WARNING( SC_ID_EMPTY_PROCESS_HANDLE_, "disable()");
00273 }
00274 
00275 // call dont_initialize() on this object instance's target.
00276 
00277 inline void sc_process_handle::dont_initialize( bool dont )
00278 {
00279     if ( m_target_p )
00280         m_target_p->dont_initialize( dont );
00281     else
00282         SC_REPORT_WARNING( SC_ID_EMPTY_PROCESS_HANDLE_, "dont_initialize()");
00283 }
00284 
00285 // dump the status of this object instance's target:
00286 
00287 inline std::string sc_process_handle::dump_state() const
00288 {
00289     return m_target_p ? m_target_p->dump_state() : std::string("NO TARGET");
00290 }
00291 
00292 // return whether this object instance's target is dynamic or not.
00293 
00294 inline bool sc_process_handle::dynamic() const
00295 {
00296     return  m_target_p ?  m_target_p->dynamic() : false;
00297 }

00299 // enable this object instance's target.

00302 {
00303     if ( m_target_p )
00304         m_target_p->enable_process(descendants);
00305     else
00306         SC_REPORT_WARNING( SC_ID_EMPTY_PROCESS_HANDLE_, "enable()");
00307 }

00313 {
00314     return m_target_p ?  m_target_p->get_child_events() : empty_event_vector;
00315 }

00318 
00319 inline

00323 }

00326

00328 {
00329     return m_target_p ?  m_target_p->get_parent_object() : NULL;
00330 }
00331 
00332 // return this object instance's target.
00333 
00334 inline sc_object* sc_process_handle::get_process_object() const
00335 {
00336     return m_target_p;
00337 }
00338 
00339 // return whether this object instance is unwinding or not.
00340 
00341 inline bool sc_process_handle::is_unwinding() const
00342 {
00343     if ( m_target_p )
00344         return m_target_p->is_unwinding();
00345     else {
00346         SC_REPORT_WARNING( SC_ID_EMPTY_PROCESS_HANDLE_, "is_unwinding()");
00347         return false;
00348     }
00349 }

00351 // kill this object instance's target.
00352 
00353 inline void sc_process_handle::kill( sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants )
00354 {
00355     if ( m_target_p )
00356         m_target_p->kill_process( descendants );
00357     else
00358         SC_REPORT_WARNING( SC_ID_EMPTY_PROCESS_HANDLE_, "kill()");
00359 }

00364 {

00366 }

00368 // return the basename of this object instance's target.

00371 {
00372     return  m_target_p ? m_target_p->basename() : "";

00375 // return the process kind for this object instance's target.
00376 
00377 inline sc_curr_proc_kind sc_process_handle::proc_kind() const
00378 {
00379     return m_target_p ?  m_target_p->proc_kind() : SC_NO_PROC_;
00380 }
00381 
00382 // reset this object instance's target.
00383 
00384 inline void sc_process_handle::reset( sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants )
00385 {
00386     if ( m_target_p )
00387         m_target_p->reset_process( sc_process_b::reset_asynchronous,
00388                                    descendants );
00389     else
00390         SC_REPORT_WARNING( SC_ID_EMPTY_PROCESS_HANDLE_, "reset()");
00391 }
00392 
00393 // return the reset event for this object instance's target.
00394 
00395 inline sc_event& sc_process_handle::reset_event() const
00396 {
00397     if ( m_target_p )
00398         return m_target_p->reset_event();
00399     else
00400     {
00401         SC_REPORT_WARNING( SC_ID_EMPTY_PROCESS_HANDLE_, "reset()");
00402         return sc_process_handle::non_event;
00403     }
00404 }
00405 
00406 // resume this object instance's target.
00407 
00408 inline void sc_process_handle::resume(sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants)
00409 {
00410     if ( m_target_p )
00411         m_target_p->resume_process(descendants);
00412     else
00413         SC_REPORT_WARNING( SC_ID_EMPTY_PROCESS_HANDLE_, "resume()");
00414 }
00415 
00416 // suspend this object instance's target.
00417 
00418 inline void sc_process_handle::suspend(sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants)
00419 {
00420     if ( m_target_p )
00421         m_target_p->suspend_process(descendants);
00422     else
00423         SC_REPORT_WARNING( SC_ID_EMPTY_PROCESS_HANDLE_, "suspend()");
00424 }
00425 
00426 // swap targets of this process handle with the supplied one.
00427 
00428 inline void sc_process_handle::swap( sc_process_handle& other )
00429 {
00430     sc_process_b* tmp = m_target_p;
00431     m_target_p = other.m_target_p;
00432     other.m_target_p = tmp;
00433 }
00434 
00435 // turn sync_reset off for this object instance's target.
00436 
00437 inline void sc_process_handle::sync_reset_off(
00438     sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants)
00439 {
00440     if ( m_target_p )
00441         m_target_p->reset_process( sc_process_b::reset_synchronous_off,
00442                                    descendants);
00443     else
00444         SC_REPORT_WARNING( SC_ID_EMPTY_PROCESS_HANDLE_, "sync_reset_off()");
00445 }
00446 
00447 // turn sync_reset on for this object instance's target.
00448 
00449 inline void sc_process_handle::sync_reset_on(
00450     sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants)
00451 {
00452     if ( m_target_p )
00453     {
00454         m_target_p->reset_process(sc_process_b::reset_synchronous_on,
00455             descendants);
00456     }
00457     else
00458     {
00459         SC_REPORT_WARNING( SC_ID_EMPTY_PROCESS_HANDLE_, "sync_reset_on()");
00460     }
00461 }
00462

00464 
00465 inline bool sc_process_handle::terminated() const
00466 {
00467     return m_target_p ?  m_target_p->terminated() : false;
00468 }
00469 
00470 // return the termination event for this object instance's target.
00471 
00472 inline sc_event& sc_process_handle::terminated_event()
00473 {
00474     if ( m_target_p )
00475         return m_target_p->terminated_event();
00476     else
00477     {
00478         SC_REPORT_WARNING( SC_ID_EMPTY_PROCESS_HANDLE_, "terminated_event()");
00479         return sc_process_handle::non_event;
00480     }
00481 }
00482 
00483 // return true if this object instance has a target, false it not.
00484 
00485 inline bool sc_process_handle::valid() const
00486 {
00487     return m_target_p ? true : false;
00488 }
00489 
00490 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00491 //"sc_process_handle::sc_throw_it"
00492 //
00493 // This method throws the supplied exception to the process whose handle this
00494 // object instance is, and optionally to the process' descendants. Once the
00495 // exception is thrown the currently executed process will suspend to allow
00496 // the exception to be propagated. Once the propagation has occurred the
00497 // current process will be resumed.
00498 //
00499 // Notes:
00500 //   (1) We allocate the helper function on the stack, see the description of
00501 //       sc_throw_it<EXCEPT>, in sc_process.h, for why.
00502 //
00503 // Arguments:
00504 //    exception = exception to be thrown
00505 //    descendants = indication of whether descendant processes should also
00506 //                  receive the throw.
00507 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00508 template<typename EXCEPT>
00509 inline void sc_process_handle::throw_it( const EXCEPT& exception,
00510     sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants)
00511 {
00512     sc_throw_it<EXCEPT> helper(exception);  // helper to throw the exception.
00513 
00514     if ( !m_target_p )
00515     {
00516         SC_REPORT_WARNING( SC_ID_EMPTY_PROCESS_HANDLE_, "throw_it()");
00517         return;
00518     }
00519     m_target_p->throw_user(helper, descendants);
00520 }
00521 
00522 
00523 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00524 //"sc_process_b::last_created_process_handle"
00525 //
00526 // This method returns the kind of this process.
00527 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00528 inline sc_process_handle sc_process_b::last_created_process_handle()
00529 {
00530     return sc_process_handle(m_last_created_process_p);
00531 }
00532 
00533 inline sc_process_handle sc_get_last_created_process_handle()
00534 {
00535     return sc_process_b::last_created_process_handle();
00536 }
